reviewText: This movie shows the struggles that often happens between fathers and sons, compititon and strained relationships. I really liked how they worked through the problems and the son proved he could do what he set out to do. Also it shows how support can help you through the darkest of times in our lives even through the guilt and depression of a losted loved one.

reviewText: The concept of the story was good and well portrayed, the young football player clearly felt a deep guilty feeling for what happened. I was a little disappointed that the dad Gould not grasp what was going on with him, though finally did near the end.

reviewText: We were under the impression that this was a good movie, but were disappointed with the use of a couple bad words in it and it showed some things too graphically for our tastes. Andrew Lawrence plays a great role and does a great job, but overall we won't watch it again as we don't want ANYTHING profane etc. in our movies...So we were disappointed all the way around...

reviewText: As a coach and Christian runner ... I appreciate the Christian teaching in this film ... the running aspects are better than most running movies ... which is to say ... not terrible ... It always amazing me that any college runner I know could have improved all the running movies out there ... and it is like they never think to talk to a runner ... the filming is good and the acting is pretty good too ... it is not for young kids ... the one missed area is they should have written in more that the main character had running ability ... he does not look in good enough shape by the end of the movie as would have actually happened ... the writer's just did a shortcut and said .. "lets make him go after the 4 minute mile" ... but the movie would have been much better if he was going after breaking a 5 minute mile ... people would have still thought that was fast, he looks like him might be able to run a 5 minute mile ... and runner's could respect that more.

reviewText: The Faith & Family DVD series are not an overtly Christian series, but they have a good message and family-safe viewing for all ages and generally have a good moral message without being "religious" in any way. This particular DVD is one of the better ones, great message and acting and story-line.
summary: Deeper than you think with a Great Message......

reviewText: This movie was a fluke. I ordered it because I like films my whole family can watch. It's a very interesting twist on friendship, family and death. It has values and believe it or not a good twist on what happens when you feel guilty. It's a story about two high school friends. When they were little they both talked about track but as they grew one of the boys went into football.When an accident happens with the kid who stuck with track the kid who went to football decides to go back to running track. Now the irony of it is that his father is the football coach and wants his son to get the scholarship with football since college is so expensive.His son instead sticks with track and starts training to run the mile in under 4 minutes.This is a story of determination and seeing the goal you want and going for it regardless of what anyone else says or thinks. I highly recommend this film.
Title: N/A
